sn3.8:4.2: Now at that time King Pasenadi of Kosala was upstairs in the stilt longhouse together with Queen Mallikā.
sn3.8:4.3: Then the king said to the queen:
sn3.8:4.4: “Mallikā, is there anyone more dear to you than yourself?”
sn3.8:4.6: But is there anyone more dear to you than yourself?”
sn3.8:5.1: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala descended from the stilt longhouse, went to the Buddha,
sn3.8:5.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn3.8:5.3: and told him what had happened.
sn3.8:6.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha recited this verse:
sn3.8:7.1: “Having explored every quarter with the mind,
sn3.8:7.2: one finds no-one dearer than oneself.
sn3.8:7.3: Likewise for others, each holds themselves dear.
sn3.8:7.4: So one who loves themselves would not harm others.”
